meanings.definition: The state of being without movement or motion.
meanings.sent1: The movelessness of the statue made it seem frozen in time.
meanings.sent2: The movelessness of the pond reflected the clear blue sky above.
meanings.sent3: The movelessness of the sloth was comical as it hung upside down from the tree.
meanings.sent4: In the movelessness of the desert, even the smallest sound echoed endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The movelessness of the night was broken only by the distant howl of a lone wolf.

meanings.definition: The quality of being still or immobile.
meanings.sent1: The movelessness of the rock made it a perfect paperweight.
meanings.sent2: The movelessness of the cat indicated it was deeply asleep.
meanings.sent3: The movelessness of the car in traffic was frustrating for the driver behind.
meanings.sent4: His movelessness during the meeting made it hard to tell if he was paying attention.
meanings.sent5: The movelessness of the mountain range was awe-inspiring against the setting sun.
